text:
First, determine the number of electrons in a neutral calcium (Ca) atom. Calcium has an atomic number of $$20$$, so it has $$20$$ electrons when it's neutral.

Since the question is about a Caå?‰¼ ion, it has lost $$2$$ electrons:

Number of electrons in Caå?‰¼ $$=$$ $$20$$ - $$2$$ $$=$$ $$18$$

**Answer: $$18$$ electrons**
